oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard from Cuba
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Postcard with a black and white photograph of a house in Havana, Cuba. Caption reads: “Residencia del Sr. Ramon Crusellas y Sr. Luis M. Santeiro, Calle N y 21 – Vedado –Habana” which translates in English to: "Residence of Mr. Ramon Crusellas and Mr. Luis M. Santeiro, N Street and 21 - Vedado -Habana"

Ramon Crusellas and his son Luis Santeiro owned of one of the largest manufacturers of perfumes and soaps in Cuba, Crusellas y Compañía, founded in 1863. The business was nationalized in 1960, forcing the Crusellas family to leave the island. They came to the United States and set up their company in Miami, Florida.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Soap trade--Cuba--History; Perfumes industry--Cuba--History.
Houses;
